audio_description: Today we'll teach you how to make Wazwan-style chicken pulao at home. We all really like Wazwan pulao, and today we’ve brought a special version for you. You can add chicken to make this Wazwan-style pulao.

audio_description: We have taken three cups of brown basmati rice and soaked it in water for an hour. If you're using white basmati, there's no need to soak it; you can cook it directly. But we’re using brown rice.

audio_description: Take a pan and heat it until it starts to smoke. Add three chopped onions, finely chopped. Fry them until they become very dark brown — the darker they get, the richer the color and flavor of your pulao will be.

audio_description: In another pan, I’ve taken 10 cups of water using a measuring cup — the same one I used to measure the rice. I will later reduce this to 6 cups. In this same water, I’ve added the onions I just browned.

audio_description: I’ve cut the chicken into smaller pieces because smaller pieces work well in pulao. But if you prefer, you can also use whole chicken pieces. Once the chicken turns brown, take it out and set it aside.
